title: Paralympic champion Marieke Vervoort dies by euthanasia
text:
Belgian Paralympian Marieke Vervoort, the London 2012 T52 100m champion has died by euthanasia at the age of 40, Belgian media reported on Tuesday.

Euthanasia is legal in Belgium and the para-athlete announced her intentions after the Rio Games in 2016 to follow that path if her degenerative condition worsened her suffering.

Despite falling sick aged 14 Vervoort pursued a sporting life with passion, playing wheelchair basketball, swimming and racing in triathlons.

She won a total of four Paralympic medals, two in 2012 and two at the 2016 Rio Games.

In 2017 she gave an exclusive, in depth interview to the Daily Telegraph - one of her last of such length - talking about her life and her struggles with pain.

“I don’t want to suffer any more,” she said. “It’s too hard for me now. I get more and more depressed. I never had these feelings before. I cry a lot.”
